summary: This bill amends Title 46 of the United States Code to expand the eligible uses of Capital Construction Funds. It allows these funds to be used for the replacement, purchase, or reconstruction of cargo handling equipment at marine terminals. The bill defines cargo handling equipment and marine terminals, and includes provisions related to job impacts of automated equipment and prohibits the purchase of cranes manufactured in China. It also outlines guidelines for qualified withdrawals and the Secretary's role in assessing the availability of U.S.-made cargo handling equipment.
